title: 15 New Beauty Products Our Editors Are Loving This December
description: Even though the start of fall feels like just yesterday, in a blink, it's already December. Halloween and Thanksgiving have come and gone, and it's time to start (and for some, wrap up) your holiday shopping. Checking off every name from your list can be daunting, but the latest launches from some of your favorite brands make it a whole lot easier. Month after month, brands have impressed us with new innovations across the hair, makeup, skin, nail, and body categories, and they certainly didn't take the month of December off. From new skin-care tools that make indulging in a little self-care oh so easy to festive makeup palettes that have us audibly gasping with every pigmented swipe, our editors have found no shortage of exciting beauty products to test - and rave about - this month. On this list, not only will you find serums, candles, lip gloss, perfumes, and even a few limited-edition sets, but you also may just find the perfect beauty gift for someone on your list (or yourself). Whether you're looking to revamp your existing beauty routine or need some stocking stuffers for your upcoming holiday celebration, we've got you covered. Keep reading to dive into the beauty products our editors are loving for December.
author: Jessica Harrington
excerpt: The best hair, makeup, skin-care, body, and fragrance launches for December 2024, according to editors. Shop the fall and winter product picks here.

On this list, not only will you find serums, candles, lip gloss, perfumes, and even a few limited-edition sets, but you also may just find the perfect beauty gift for someone on your list (or yourself). Whether you're looking to revamp your existing beauty routine or need some stocking stuffers for your upcoming holiday celebration, we've got you covered. Keep reading to dive into the beauty products our editors are loving for December.sephora.comBest High-Shine Lip TreatmentOlehenriksen x Anine Bing Peptide Lip Treatment ($22) "I firmly disagree with the notion that a lip balm is a lip balm is a lip balm — and in the cold winter months, you know what I'm talking about. This lip treatment from Olehenriksen is everything you need in one: heavy hydrators like mango butter and cloudberry oil, a pretty mauve color that looks good on any skin tone, and a high-shine, glossy finish that doesn't feel gloopy. The cutesy packaging is an added bonus and comes courtesy of fashion icon, Anine Bing." — Kelsey Castañon, senior content directorviolettefr.comBest EyeshadowViolette_Fr Yeux Paint in Café Serré ($32) "As a person with blue eyes, my go-to shadow and liner colors are in the red, pink, gold, and brown families. My latest obsession is with the new color of Violette_Fr's Yeux Paint — it's a stunning shade of red wine burgundy that makes my eyes look incredible. I have used it as a full-lid shadow for a more dramatic vibe and also applied it with a liner brush for a soft wing. It stays put nicely after it's dried down (which takes about 10 seconds) — I'm planning on wearing it to all of my holiday parties this year." — Aviel Kanter, director, branded contentsephora.comBest Face WashYouth to the People Superfruit Gentle Exfoliating Cleanser with Vitamin C + Papaya ($27, originally $39) "I have sensitive, reactive, acne-prone, dry skin. Yeah, it's a mouthful. That's why when I find skin-care products that work for me, I usually stick to them for years and years. I was recently introduced to the Youth to the People Superfruit Gentle Exfoliating Cleanser, and it's been the perfect face wash to help slough off dead skin in the colder months without making my face feel too dry. It's gentle and leaves my skin looking bright. I'll be using it for the foreseeable future." — Renee Rodriguez, staff writer and social producerbloomingdales.comBest MoisturizerShiseido Future Solution LX Total Regenerating Cream ($298) "It's that time of year when my skin is just not happy. It feels dry, tight, and dull — unless I find the perfect moisturizer consistency to envelope it in soothing hydration. The Shiseido Future Solution LX Total Regenerating Cream has a thick but weightless texture that instantly soothes, melting into my skin without any greasy residue but lingers enough to feel comforting. The formula is made to plump, smooth, and firm, and when I use it, I notice a visible difference in my skin when I wake up." — Jessica Harrington, senior beauty editormarykay.comBest Wrinkle TreatmentMary Kay Clinical Solutions Dynamic Wrinkle Limiter ($58) "Listen, I love Botox as much as the next person, but I also like to minimize how often I go for treatment — it's time-consuming, not to mention pricy. The new Mary Kay Clinical Solutions Dynamic Wrinkle Limiter that just came out helps minimize the appearance of wrinkles, leaving skin looking plump and smooth. While no product applied topically will ever be a replacement for injections, I've found this certainly helps in between treatments." — JHbluemercury.comBest Night CreamSisley Paris Phyto Blanc Overnight Brightening Cream ($285) "Night cream is probably my favorite type of skin-care product. So much restoration happens to the skin overnight, so a potent moisturizer is key. Every time I've used this brightening cream, I've woken up with plumper skin than I went to bed with. Rainbow algae extract combined with the patented phyto-blanc complex help brighten dark spots and glycerin, vitamin B5, and shea oil hydrate and protect." — AKcotebeauty.comBest Hydrating Lip TreatmentCôte Beauty The Ritual Peptide Enriched Lip Treatment ($28) "I'm a lip-product snob through and through, and I'm a little ashamed to say that my standards for lip glosses, lip balms, and lipsticks are higher than my standards for dudes I date. (I'm working on it in therapy!) I like products that are hydrating, moisturizing, and long lasting — but they can't be sticky or leave behind a funky residue. I was excited to find that the Côte Beauty The Ritual Peptide Enriched Lip Treatment ticked off all of my boxes and left my mouth looking luscious AF. Immediate re-purchase." — RRamazon.comBest Hair MaskKMS Moist Repair Intense Restore Treatment ($13) "This time of year, my hair is all-caps SCREAMING for help in the dryness department, and yet no hair mask or treatment really makes any meaningful change. That all changed with this packet of goodness from KMS, which is loaded with hydrating ingredients like shea butter, coconut oil, and prickly pear that's been upcycled. I use it once a week for three minutes on my ends, and every time I step out of the shower it looks like I just got a haircut (even when it's been months)." — Kelsey Castañon, senior content directorcredobeauty.comBest Body CreamEvolvetogether Havana Body Cream ($46, originally $58) "There are delicious smelling products, and then there is the Havana scent from Evolvetogether. It is equal parts woody and spicy, with hits of cardamom and cedarwood that dry down to the kind of warmth you get by cozying up next to a fire. I've loved every single item I've tried in the brand's Havana collection — the hand cream, the deodorant, the exfoliating bar soap, the hand sanitizer — but my biggest love affair yet is with its newly launched body cream-to-oil formula. This hydrator is at once rich and fast-absorbing, thanks to its powerhouse argan, sunflower seed, and avocado oils. If you want something you won't hate slathering on this winter, don't miss it." — Kelsey Castañon, senior content directorulta.comBest Body-Care KitBeekman 1802 x Wicked Glamorous Gal Body Care Gift Set ($28) "I, like 99 percent of the population right now, am obsessed with the new 'Wicked' movie starring Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo. I can't stop humming the iconic songs, and that obsession extends to the many (and I mean many, many, many) limited-edition collections that have come from the film, including the Beekman 1802 x Wicked Glamorous Gal Body Care Gift Set. It's the perfect gift for fellow 'Wicked' fans. Inside are two products that'll keep skin hydrated all winter long: the Pink Perfection Goat Milk Soap and You've Been Glinda-Fied Shimmering Whipped Body." — JHsaltyface.comBest Self-TannerSaltyface Tanning Foam ($62) "I don't self tan very often, but when I do, I'm picky about the products that go on my body. I've been a fan of a specific tanning lotion for years, until I was introduced to a new brand, Saltyface. Their tanning foam is genuinely one of the easiest tanning products I've ever tested — and it only needs to be worn for 60 minutes before you can wash it off. I spread it all over my body using just my hands, and it gives me the most perfect, even-toned color. Yes, it smells the tiniest bit on application day, but that goes away as soon as I shower. Plus, it doesn't fade with splotches whatsoever. Obsessed is an understatement." — RRdndgel.comBest Nail PolishDND Gel Diva Happy Trails Collection in Triple Espresso ($12) "The shade Triple Espresso from the new DND Gel Diva Happy Trails collection is the most beautiful coffee-brown hue. It has reddish undertones and offers amazing coverage. It's the perfect timeless yet oh-so-trendy nail color for the winter season ahead." — JHvacation.incBest CandleVacation Royal Pine Deluxe Candle ($36) "I'm doing a lot of holiday shopping this month, and I've never seen anyone upset on the other side of a gifted candle, but how do you find one that feels both universal and personalized? Enter Vacation's Royal Pine Deluxe Candle: its delicious pine scent makes it perfect for the person who hosts every holiday party, while the design makes for the person who's turned 'tenniscore' into their entire personality, embraces all things aprés ski, or generally just appreciates an aesthetically pleasing candle." — Kelsey Castañon, senior content directorsephora.comBest PerfumeMaison Louis Marie Nouvelle Vague Eau de Parfum ($70, was $93) "I'm super picky about perfumes, and I especially dislike scents that skew too syrup-y sweet (blame it on my childhood spent inhaling the musks of the Limited Too and Abercrombie stores at the mall). I prefer floral perfumes that are balanced out by more grounded scents like bergamot or fig. I know Maison Louis Marie's claim to fame is Bois de Balincourt, but hear me out — IMO Nouvelle Vague should be their best seller. It's what I imagine Marge from The Talented Mr. Ripley wears during her Italian-coast sabbatical — full of citrus, fig, and tonka." — AKJessica Harrington (she/her) is the senior editor of PS Beauty, where she oversees coverage around makeup, skin care, hair, tattoos, and more. With more than eight years of industry experience, she has interviewed countless celebrities, reported on hundreds of beauty trends, and swatched more lipsticks than she can count. Prior to PS, Jessica worked for publications such as Makeup.com, Skincare.com, and The Zoe Report. Renee Rodriguez (she/her) is a staff writer and social producer for PS. She writes across all verticals, but her main areas of expertise focus on fashion and beauty content with an emphasis on reviews and editor experiments. She also produces social content for the PS TikTok and Instagram accounts.

Olehenriksen x Anine Bing Peptide Lip Treatment ($22)

"I have sensitive, reactive, acne-prone, dry skin. Yeah, it's a mouthful. That's why when I find skin-care products that work for me, I usually stick to them for years and years. I was recently introduced to the Youth to the People Superfruit Gentle Exfoliating Cleanser, and it's been the perfect face wash to help slough off dead skin in the colder months without making my face feel too dry. It's gentle and leaves my skin looking bright. I'll be using it for the foreseeable future." — Renee Rodriguez, staff writer and social producer

The formula is made to plump, smooth, and firm, and when I use it, I notice a visible difference in my skin when I wake up." — Jessica Harrington, senior beauty editor

Best Wrinkle Treatment

Mary Kay Clinical Solutions Dynamic Wrinkle Limiter ($58)

"Listen, I love Botox as much as the next person, but I also like to minimize how often I go for treatment — it's time-consuming, not to mention pricy. The new Mary Kay Clinical Solutions Dynamic Wrinkle Limiter that just came out helps minimize the appearance of wrinkles, leaving skin looking plump and smooth. While no product applied topically will ever be a replacement for injections, I've found this certainly helps in between treatments." — JH

Best Night Cream

Sisley Paris Phyto Blanc Overnight Brightening Cream ($285)

"Night cream is probably my favorite type of skin-care product. So much restoration happens to the skin overnight, so a potent moisturizer is key. "I'm a lip-product snob through and through, and I'm a little ashamed to say that my standards for lip glosses, lip balms, and lipsticks are higher than my standards for dudes I date. (I'm working on it in therapy!) I like products that are hydrating, moisturizing, and long lasting — but they can't be sticky or leave behind a funky residue. I was excited to find that the Côte Beauty The Ritual Peptide Enriched Lip Treatment ticked off all of my boxes and left my mouth looking luscious AF. Immediate re-purchase." — RR

Best Hair Mask

KMS Moist Repair Intense Restore Treatment ($13)

"This time of year, my hair is all-caps SCREAMING for help in the dryness department, and yet no hair mask or treatment really makes any meaningful change. That all changed with this packet of goodness from KMS, which is loaded with hydrating ingredients like shea butter, coconut oil, and prickly pear that's been upcycled. Best Body Cream

Evolvetogether Havana Body Cream ($46, originally $58)

"There are delicious smelling products, and then there is the Havana scent from Evolvetogether. It is equal parts woody and spicy, with hits of cardamom and cedarwood that dry down to the kind of warmth you get by cozying up next to a fire. I've loved every single item I've tried in the brand's Havana collection — the hand cream, the deodorant, the exfoliating bar soap, the hand sanitizer — but my biggest love affair yet is with its newly launched body cream-to-oil formula. This hydrator is at once rich and fast-absorbing, thanks to its powerhouse argan, sunflower seed, and avocado oils. If you want something you won't hate slathering on this winter, don't miss it." — Kelsey Castañon, senior content director

Best Body-Care Kit

Beekman 1802 x Wicked Glamorous Gal Body Care Gift Set ($28)

"I, like 99 percent of the population right now, am obsessed with the new 'Wicked' movie starring Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo. I can't stop humming the iconic songs, and that obsession extends to the many (and I mean many, many, many) limited-edition collections that have come from the film, including the Beekman 1802 x Wicked Glamorous Gal Body Care Gift Set. It's the perfect gift for fellow 'Wicked' fans. Inside are two products that'll keep skin hydrated all winter long: the Pink Perfection Goat Milk Soap and You've Been Glinda-Fied Shimmering Whipped Body." — JH

Best Self-Tanner

Saltyface Tanning Foam ($62)

"I don't self tan very often, but when I do, I'm picky about the products that go on my body. I've been a fan of a specific tanning lotion for years, until I was introduced to a new brand, Saltyface. Their tanning foam is genuinely one of the easiest tanning products I've ever tested — and it only needs to be worn for 60 minutes before you can wash it off. I spread it all over my body using just my hands, and it gives me the most perfect, even-toned color. Yes, it smells the tiniest bit on application day, but that goes away as soon as I shower. Plus, it doesn't fade with splotches whatsoever. Obsessed is an understatement." — RR

Best Nail Polish

DND Gel Diva Happy Trails Collection in Triple Espresso ($12)

"The shade Triple Espresso from the new DND Gel Diva Happy Trails collection is the most beautiful coffee-brown hue. It has reddish undertones and offers amazing coverage. It's the perfect timeless yet oh-so-trendy nail color for the winter season ahead." — JH

Best Candle

Vacation Royal Pine Deluxe Candle ($36)

"I'm doing a lot of holiday shopping this month, and I've never seen anyone upset on the other side of a gifted candle, but how do you find one that feels both universal and personalized? Enter Vacation's Royal Pine Deluxe Candle: its delicious pine scent makes it perfect for the person who hosts every holiday party, while the design makes for the person who's turned 'tenniscore' into their entire personality, embraces all things aprés ski, or generally just appreciates an aesthetically pleasing candle." — Kelsey Castañon, senior content director

Best Perfume

Maison Louis Marie Nouvelle Vague Eau de Parfum ($70, was $93)

"I'm super picky about perfumes, and I especially dislike scents that skew too syrup-y sweet (blame it on my childhood spent inhaling the musks of the Limited Too and Abercrombie stores at the mall). I prefer floral perfumes that are balanced out by more grounded scents like bergamot or fig. I know Maison Louis Marie's claim to fame is Bois de Balincourt, but hear me out — IMO Nouvelle Vague should be their best seller. It's what I imagine Marge from The Talented Mr. Ripley wears during her Italian-coast sabbatical — full of citrus, fig, and tonka." — AK
